discussion_comments.comment_body:
`require(ESM)` is only supported (without a flag) for Node 20.19.0+, 22.12.0.
https://nodejs.org/docs/latest-v20.x/api/modules.html#loading-ecmascript-modules-using-require
Do we want to bump the version to that version? Or would it be fine to say "if you want to use CJS, update the Node version"?

I think we should require Node 20.19.0+, 22.12.0+. To keep things cleaner, maybe we could merge this PR as "remove node 18 support" as it removes several branches we needed for it, and then propose the `require(esm)` by default range in another PR?

`packages/vite/src/node/__tests__/package.json` was picked up for `packages/vite/src/node/__tests__/build.spec.ts` by eslint-plugin-n and because that package.json does not have `engines` field, `>=16.0.0` was used and an lint error happened for `util.stripVTCharacters`.
https://github.com/eslint-community/eslint-plugin-n?tab=readme-ov-file#configured-nodejs-version-range
I set this to make `^18.0.0 || ^20.0.0 || >=22.0.0` to be applied across the repo.
